wiki.content: This, the title track from the 1964 album The Sidewinder, was one of the defining recordings of the soul jazz genre, becoming a jazz standard. An edited version was released as a single. The album was recorded at the Van Gelder Studio, Englewood, New Jersey. It was released on Blue Note label as BLP 4157 and BST 84157. This theme is used in a chrysler commercial and also used by Noir Désir in Lolita Nie En Bloc from the album One Trip One Noise. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Sidewinder Noir Désir Lolita Nie En Bloc User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: This, the title track from the 1964 album The Sidewinder, was one of the defining recordings of the soul jazz genre, becoming a jazz standard. An edited version was released as a single. The album was recorded at the Van Gelder Studio, Englewood, New Jersey. It was released on Blue Note label as BLP 4157 and BST 84157. This theme is used in a chrysler commercial and also used by Noir Désir in Lolita Nie En Bloc from the album One Trip One Noise. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Sidewinder Noir Désir

track.name: The Sidewinder
comments: Jazz, Jazz, Jazz, Jazz, Jazz! Totally Brilliant!
WOULD HAVE COULD HAVE BEEN A LEGEND GREAT TRUMPET PLAYER
Jazz, Jazz, Jazz, Jazz, Jazz, totally brilliant!
Huge smile on my face while I dance irresistibly. The groove is impeccable.
Thanks Uncle Alfred... This takes me back!!!
This is a track i enjoyed playing back home in my humble beginnings playing smokey night clubs around dayton,ohio and cincy!
so smart, so sharp, straight to the heart

It riddles and it's got a sting. It's a sidewinder. It's still got a fizz and swing after fifty years. It's going strong. Lee Morgan (trumpet), Joe Henderson (tenor saxophones), Billy Higgins(drums), Bob Cranshaw (bass), Barry Harris (piano)
Most of those jazz geniuses seem to have passed away so young...sad.
Oh... I'm movin' baby, right here at my desktop... I just hope the security guards don't  come and remove me from the work place for having a melt down.
i dare you not to move with this rhythm...!
Diggin the groove :)  Totally goes with VBA programming right now ^^
Great work here by the rhythm section.
